frontmatter.title: Complex Searching with intake and analysing employing xarray

affiliations.id: University at Albany (State University of New York)
affiliations.name: University at Albany (State University of New York)

children.label: Complex Searching with intake and analysing employing xarray

children.value: This tutorial we will present access multiple historical (as an example here) data available and analyze  using
. Put them in a dictionary format employing
and plotting simple area average time series over a specific region.

import warnings
import intake
from distributed import Client
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import xarray as xr
import dask
xr.set_options(display_style='html')
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

children.value:
cat = col.search(experiment_id=["historical"],
    variable_id = ["tas"],
    member_id = ["r1i1p1f1"],
    table_id = ["Amon",], 
    source_id = [ "CMCC-ESM2", "CanESM5", "CESM2", "CESM2-FV2", ]
)

    /* Turns off some styling */
    progress {
        /* gets rid of default border in Firefox and Opera. */
        border: none;
        /* Needs to be in here for Safari polyfill so background images work as expected. */
        background-size: auto;
    }
    progress:not([value]), progress:not([value])::-webkit-progress-bar {
        background: repeating-linear-gradient(45deg, #7e7e7e, #7e7e7e 10px, #5c5c5c 10px, #5c5c5c 20px);
    }
    .progress-bar-interrupted, .progress-bar-interrupted::-webkit-progress-bar {
        background: #F44336;
    }
</style>

children.value:
ds = {}

for key in dset_dict.keys():
    # Sort the dataset by time
    sorted_dataset = dset_dict[key].sortby("time")
    
    # Subset data for years 1900-2000
    ds[key] = sorted_dataset.sel(time=slice("1900", "2000"))
        
    # Optional: Print a message indicating dataset processing
    print(f"Processing dataset: {key}")

children.value: Visualizing the regional mean for each dataset

children.label: Visualizing the regional mean for each dataset

children.value:
for key, regm in regn_mean.items():
    source_id = key.split('.')[2]
    regm.plot(label=source_id)
    plt.title(f"Mean Surface Air Temperature for {source_id}")
    plt.xlabel('Time')
    plt.ylabel('Temperature (K)')
    plt.legend()
    plt.show()
Calculating annual mean for each dataset  and visualizing time series

children.value: Visualizing the regional annual mean for each dataset

children.label: Visualizing the regional annual mean for each dataset

children.value:
for key, anmn in annual_mean.items():
    source_id = key.split('.')[2]
    anmn.plot(label=source_id)
    plt.title(f"Mean Annual Surface Air Temperature for {source_id}")
    plt.xlabel('Time')
    plt.ylabel('Temperature (K)')
    plt.legend()
    plt.show()
Visualizing the regional annual mean for each dataset in a single panel

children.label: Visualizing the regional annual mean for each dataset in a single panel

children.value:
# Create the plot
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))

# Plotting the annual mean for each dataset on the same plot
for key, annm in annual_mean.items():
    source_id = key.split('.')[2]
    annm.plot(label=source_id)

plt.title("Annual Mean Surface Air Temperature (Regional)")
plt.xlabel('Time')
plt.ylabel('Temperature (K)')
plt.legend()
plt.show()
